00014 int main(int argc,char *argv[])
00015 {
00016   int server_port;
00017   int sock,sock2;
00018   struct sockaddr_in sa,sa2;
00019   int rc;
00020 
00021   /* parse command line args */
00022   if (argc != 3)
00023   {
00024     fprintf(stderr, "usage: http_server1 k|u port\n");
00025     exit(-1);
00026   }
00027   server_port = atoi(argv[2]);
00028   if (server_port < 1500)
00029   {
00030     fprintf(stderr,"INVALID PORT NUMBER: %d; can't be < 1500\n",server_port);
00031     exit(-1);
00032   }
00033 
00034   /* initialize and make socket */
00035   if (toupper(*(argv[1]))=='K') {
00036     minet_init(MINET_KERNEL);
00037   } else if (toupper(*(argv[1]))=='U') {
00038     minet_init(MINET_USER);
00039   } else {
00040     fprintf(stderr, "First argument must be k or u\n");
00041     exit(-1);
00042   }
00043   sock = minet_socket(SOCK_STREAM);
00044   if (sock < 0)
00045   {
00046     minet_perror("couldn't make socket\n");
00047     exit(-1);
00048   }
00049 
00050   /* set server address*/
00051   memset(&sa, 0, sizeof sa);
00052   sa.sin_port = htons(server_port);
00053   sa.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
00054   sa.sin_family = AF_INET;
00055 
00056   /* bind listening socket */
00057   rc = minet_bind(sock,&sa);
00058   if (rc < 0)
00059   {
00060     minet_perror("couldn't bind\n");
00061     exit(-1);
00062   }
00063 
00064   /* start listening */
00065   rc = minet_listen(sock,5);
00066   if (rc < 0)
00067   {
00068     minet_perror("couldn't listen\n");
00069     exit(-1);
00070   }
00071 
00072   /* connection handling loop */
00073   while(1)
00074   {
00075     sock2 = minet_accept(sock,&sa2);
00076     if (sock2 < 0)
00077     {
00078       minet_perror("Error accepting a connection ");
00079       continue;
00080     }
00081     rc = handle_connection(sock2);
00082   }
00083 }

00085 int handle_connection(int sock2)
00086 {
00087   char filename[FILENAMESIZE+1];
00088   int rc;
00089   int fd;
00090   struct stat filestat;
00091   char buf[BUFSIZE+1];
00092   char *headers;
00093   char *endheaders;
00094   char *bptr;
00095   int datalen=0;
00096   char *ok_response_f = "HTTP/1.0 200 OK\r\n"\
00097                       "Content-type: text/plain\r\n"\
00098                       "Content-length: %d \r\n\r\n";
00099   char ok_response[100];
00100   char *notok_response = "HTTP/1.0 404 FILE NOT FOUND\r\n"\
00101                          "Content-type: text/html\r\n\r\n"\
00102                          "<html><body bgColor=black text=white>\n"\
00103                          "<h2>404 FILE NOT FOUND</h2>\n"
00104                          "</body></html>\n";
00105   bool ok=true;
00106 
00107   /* first read loop -- get request and headers*/
00108   while ((rc = minet_read(sock2,buf+datalen,BUFSIZE-datalen)) > 0)
00109   {
00110     datalen += rc;
00111     buf[datalen] = '\0';
00112     if ((endheaders = strstr(buf,"\r\n\r\n")) != NULL)
00113     {
00114       endheaders[2] = '\0';
00115       endheaders += 4;
00116       headers =(char *) malloc(strlen(buf)+1); //not used here, for future
00117       strcpy(headers,buf);
00118       break;
00119     }
00120   }
00121   if (rc < 0)
00122   {
00123       minet_perror("Error reading request\n");
00124       minet_close(sock2);
00125       return -1;
00126   }
00127 
00128   /* parse request to get file name */
00129   /* Assumption: this is a GET request and filename contains no spaces*/
00130   bptr = buf;
00131   strsep(&bptr," ");
00132   bptr = strsep(&bptr," ");
00133   if (bptr == NULL)
00134   {
00135     ok = false;
00136   }
00137   else
00138   {
00139     if (strlen(bptr) > FILENAMESIZE)
00140       {
00141         fprintf(stderr,"Filename too big\n");
00142         minet_close(sock2);
00143         return -1;
00144       }
00145     if (bptr[0] == '/')
00146       bptr += 1;
00147     strcpy(filename,bptr);
00148 
00149     /* try opening the file */
00150     fd = open(filename,O_RDONLY);
00151     if (fd < 0)
00152       {
00153         ok = false;
00154         //printf("couldn't open file %s\n",filename);
00155       }
00156   }
00157 
00158   /* send response */
00159   if (ok)
00160   {
00161     /* send headers */
00162     rc = stat(filename,&filestat);
00163     if (rc < 0)
00164     {
00165       perror("error getting file stat ");
00166       minet_close(sock2);
00167       return -1;
00168     }
00169     sprintf(ok_response,ok_response_f,filestat.st_size);
00170     rc = writenbytes(sock2,ok_response,strlen(ok_response));
00171     if (rc < 0)
00172     {
00173       minet_perror("error writing response\n");
00174       minet_close(sock2);
00175       return -1;
00176     }
00177 
00178     /* send file */
00179     while ((rc = read(fd,buf,BUFSIZE)) != 0)
00180     {
00181       if (rc < 0)
00182       {
00183         fprintf(stderr,"error reading requested file %s\n",filename);
00184         break;
00185       }
00186       else
00187       {
00188         rc = writenbytes(sock2, buf, rc);
00189         if (rc < 0)
00190         {
00191           minet_perror("error writing response\n");
00192           minet_close(sock2);
00193           return -1;
00194         }
00195       }
00196     }
00197   }
00198   else
00199   {
00200     rc = writenbytes(sock2,notok_response,strlen(notok_response));
00201     if (rc < 0)
00202     {
00203       minet_perror("error writing response\n");
00204       minet_close(sock2);
00205       return -1;
00206     }
00207   }
00208 
00209   //free(headers);
00210   minet_close(sock2);
00211 
00212   if (ok)
00213     return 0;
00214   else
00215     return -1;
00216 }

00218 int readnbytes(int fd,char *buf,int size)
00219 {
00220   int rc = 0;
00221   int totalread = 0;
00222   while ((rc = minet_read(fd,buf+totalread,size-totalread)) > 0)
00223     totalread += rc;
00224 
00225   if (rc < 0)
00226   {
00227     return -1;
00228   }
00229   else
00230     return totalread;

00233 int writenbytes(int fd,char *str,int size)
00234 {
00235   int rc = 0;
00236   int totalwritten =0;
00237   while ((rc = minet_write(fd,str+totalwritten,size-totalwritten)) > 0)
00238     totalwritten += rc;
00239 
00240   if (rc < 0)
00241     return -1;
00242   else
